SENT.plain: Saethre-Chotzen syndrome due to TWIST1 mutations is characterized by coronal synostosis, facial dysmorphism and additional variable anomalies
Small deletions comprising the whole TWIST1 account for a small proportion of patients with Saethre-Chotzen syndrome
Here we describe 3 patients with facial dysmorphism, marked microcephaly, short stature (2/3 patients), and overlapping 7p21 microdeletions
Molecular karyotyping identified small deletions of chromosome 7p21 including TWIST1 with a size of 526 kb, 9.2 Mb, and 11.7 Mb, respectively
The clinical manifestations of these patients do not resemble the typical phenotype of Saethre-Chotzen syndrome
In the two patients with larger microdeletions, severe mental retardation and significant short stature are present
Facial dysmorphism of patient 3 includes also signs of blepharophimosis-ptosis-epicanthus inversus syndrome
